meanings.definition: To produce a design, text, or picture on a surface using a lithographic process.
meanings.sent1: She lithographed her artwork onto the canvas with precision.
meanings.sent2: The company lithographed the book cover beautifully.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat lithographed paw prints all over the freshly painted floor.
meanings.sent4: His memories were lithographed in his mind like a permanent etching.
meanings.sent5: The artist lithographed a vibrant sunset scene that captured everyone's attention.

meanings.sent1: The lithographed poster caught the eye of every passerby.
meanings.sent2: The lithographed map was clear and detailed.
meanings.sent3: The lithographed invitation added an elegant touch to the event.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright as a lithographed picture.
meanings.sent5: The lithographed brochure showcased the beauty of the national park.
